HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)

HDG.LOG.content: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]

HDG.IM.content: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history
HDG.IM.linkedContent: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]

HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]

HDG.BC.content: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

HDG.BC.content: Being “is”: doesn’t Being become a being in this phrase, become what it’s supposed to be differentiated from? can it ever become manifest as Being?
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being “is”: doesn’t Being become a being in this phrase, become what it’s supposed to be differentiated from? can it ever become manifest as Being?

HDG.BC.content: [practice, method, askesis] justifications for attempt meaningless if attempt at such remembrance not carried out: remembering return into 1st inception of Western thinking brings w/ it all signs of violence [risk the worst?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [practice, method, askesis] justifications for attempt meaningless if attempt at such remembrance not carried out: remembering return into 1st inception of Western thinking brings w/ it all signs of violence [risk the worst?]

HDG.BC.content: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.TB.content: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TB.linkedContent: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

HDG.TB.content: saying of Appropriation in form of a lecture remains itself an obstacle of this kind [metaphysical obstacles that render such saying inadequate] > lecture has spoke merely in propositional statements
HDG.TB.linkedContent: saying of Appropriation in form of a lecture remains itself an obstacle of this kind [metaphysical obstacles that render such saying inadequate] > lecture has spoke merely in propositional statements

HDG.WM.content: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)
HDG.WM.linkedContent: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)

HDG.WM.content: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WM.linkedContent: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”

HDG.WM.content: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WM.linkedContent: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

HDG.QB.content: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion
HDG.QB.linkedContent: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion

HDG.QB.content: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]

HDG.QB.content: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings
HDG.QB.linkedContent: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings

HDG.QB.content: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying
HDG.QB.linkedContent: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

HDG.FS.content: diapheromenon (of Heraclitus) unfolding (Entfaltung) of contraries, grounded in inapparent character (Unscheinbaren) of logos > opposites exclude, contraries correspond (“Die Gegensätze schliessen einander aus, während die Widerwendigen sich entsprechen”) > [correspond as letting each other reciprocally come forth]

HDG.FS.content: Kant’s Vorstellung (representation): 1) particular representation (intuition), this book 2) representation in general, the book as such (object as object)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kant’s Vorstellung (representation): 1) particular representation (intuition), this book 2) representation in general, the book as such (object as object)

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: the a of alētheia, a privation that corresponds to excess, privation is not negation, the concealment in unconcealment (which grows more powerful the more strongly it becomes what phuein indicates [?])
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the a of alētheia, a privation that corresponds to excess, privation is not negation, the concealment in unconcealment (which grows more powerful the more strongly it becomes what phuein indicates [?])

HDG.FS.content: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)

HDG.FS.content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

HDG.FS.content: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]

HDG.MA.content: possible that technology in atomic age could captivate/bewitch/dazzle/beguile so that calculative thinking accepted/practiced as the only way of thinking [end of philosophy] > keep meditative thinking: persistent courageous thinking allows Gelassenheit, openness to Geheimnis, to flourish

HDG.CCP.content: objects, things-in-themselves: such terminology freezes thought > “after that scholarly reservation, you shouldn’t hesitate to speak in a scholarly manner”

HDG.CCP.content: coming near & remaining distant from Gegnet > such remaining is a returning > Gegnet would be nearing & distancing > Genet itself: nearness of distance, distance of nearness
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: coming near & remaining distant from Gegnet > such remaining is a returning > Gegnet would be nearing & distancing > Genet itself: nearness of distance, distance of nearness

HDG.DL.content: gesture (Gebärde) (gathering of a bearing [eines Tragens]) helps us experience (erfahren) truly what is to be said [about language?] [?], you intentionally avoid saying [cf. HASD]: our bearing (unseres Tragens, unseres Betragens), what truly bears (eigentlich Tragende), bears itself toward us (uns sich erst zu-trägt)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: gesture (Gebärde) (gathering of a bearing [eines Tragens]) helps us experience (erfahren) truly what is to be said [about language?] [?], you intentionally avoid saying [cf. HASD]: our bearing (unseres Tragens, unseres Betragens), what truly bears (eigentlich Tragende), bears itself toward us (uns sich erst zu-trägt)

HDG.DL.content: must guard (hüten) the ways toward language > enough just to build a bypath (Seitenpfad) toward the ways [arrival?] > speaking of hints seems to indicate (weisen) a trail (Spur) [trace] of such a path (Pfad] [bypath to way]

HDG.DL.linkedContent: must guard (hüten) the ways toward language > enough just to build a bypath (Seitenpfad) toward the ways [arrival?] > speaking of hints seems to indicate (weisen) a trail (Spur) [trace] of such a path (Pfad] [bypath to way]

HDG.DL.content: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.DL.linkedContent: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.LP.content: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth

HDG.LP.content: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.LP.linkedContent: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

HDG.LP.content: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity
HDG.LP.linkedContent: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity

HDG.LP.content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

HDG.LP.content: speaking from wandering of apartness, this language of poetry always speaks of what it leaves behind, what it parts from, and of that to which the departure submits (der Abschied sich bescheidet)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.LP.linkedContent: speaking from wandering of apartness, this language of poetry always speaks of what it leaves behind, what it parts from, and of that to which the departure submits (der Abschied sich bescheidet)

HDG.WL.content: mystery (Geheimnis) of language: language speaks solely w/ itself alone (Sie spricht einzig und einsam mit sich selber) > if we experience the way to language re: what happens along the way [rather than using scientific propositions], an intimation (Vermutung) may come in which language strikes us (anmutet) as strange

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: mystery (Geheimnis) of language: language speaks solely w/ itself alone (Sie spricht einzig und einsam mit sich selber) > if we experience the way to language re: what happens along the way [rather than using scientific propositions], an intimation (Vermutung) may come in which language strikes us (anmutet) as strange

HDG.WL.content: speech, not a secure possession (kein fester Besitz) > in shock, a man may be silent; in an accident, a man becomes mute (not silent) > language manifests itself in speaking (Die Sprache zeigt sich im Sprechen) as activation of organs of speech (mouth, lips, teeth, tongue, larynx)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: speech, not a secure possession (kein fester Besitz) > in shock, a man may be silent; in an accident, a man becomes mute (not silent) > language manifests itself in speaking (Die Sprache zeigt sich im Sprechen) as activation of organs of speech (mouth, lips, teeth, tongue, larynx)

HDG.WL.content: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant

HDG.WL.content: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

HDG.WL.content: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.EC.content: did the younger man experience what is healing (das Heilsame) in contrast (Gegensatz) to the unwholesomeness (heillosen) of Camp? a fleeting self-deception? > no, because it has abided since morning in such a releasing (lösend), signifying (deutend), gathering manner…
HDG.EC.linkedContent: did the younger man experience what is healing (das Heilsame) in contrast (Gegensatz) to the unwholesomeness (heillosen) of Camp? a fleeting self-deception? > no, because it has abided since morning in such a releasing (lösend), signifying (deutend), gathering manner…

HDG.EC.content: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]

HDG.EC.content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.EC.linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

HDG.EC.content: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation

HDG.EC.content: freedom rests in being able to let, to let something be in that which it rests, so rare for man to let as such [so rare for man to be free] > this freedom alone true superiority (Überlegenheit), doesn’t need anything below it to remain above [Übermensch?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: freedom rests in being able to let, to let something be in that which it rests, so rare for man to let as such [so rare for man to be free] > this freedom alone true superiority (Überlegenheit), doesn’t need anything below it to remain above [Übermensch?]

HDG.OHF.content: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)

HDG.OHF.content: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked

HDG.OHF.content: fundamental questionableness (Fraglichkeit) in Vorhabe, only as such could there be something like: “fixing” on an end (ein Ende “fest” machen), what is fixed on (or not) has being (Sein hat!) as a how of Dasein: how to relate this to death?
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: fundamental questionableness (Fraglichkeit) in Vorhabe, only as such could there be something like: “fixing” on an end (ein Ende “fest” machen), what is fixed on (or not) has being (Sein hat!) as a how of Dasein: how to relate this to death?

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: [method] [from] as what is factical Dasein being encountered in historical consciousness & philosophy? [to] what does factical Dasein have itself in these interpretations? [to] what is the having-itself-there of Da-sein as being, as a How of facticity, as an existential?

HDG.OHF.content: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: significance not a characteristic of things but of being > theories re: actuality (Wirklichkeit) and reality need to be subjected (unterwerfen) to critical phenomenological destruction: such a critique only actualized (vollziehen) from out of positive insight (Sicht) [already attend to Being?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: significance not a characteristic of things but of being > theories re: actuality (Wirklichkeit) and reality need to be subjected (unterwerfen) to critical phenomenological destruction: such a critique only actualized (vollziehen) from out of positive insight (Sicht) [already attend to Being?]

HDG.OHF.content: as-what and How of the being-encountered (Begegnens) of what is close to us/given: significance > significant: being, being-there, in How of definite signifying/pointing (bestimmten Be-deutens) > wherein such definiteness consists, How a Dasein announces itself (sich bekundet), needs to be brought out from the concrete [?] > definiteness as disclosedness (Erschlossenheit): 1) availability in advance (Vorhandenheit) 2) advance appearance of a with-world (in dem mitweltlichen Vor-schein)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what and How of the being-encountered (Begegnens) of what is close to us/given: significance > significant: being, being-there, in How of definite signifying/pointing (bestimmten Be-deutens) > wherein such definiteness consists, How a Dasein announces itself (sich bekundet), needs to be brought out from the concrete [?] > definiteness as disclosedness (Erschlossenheit): 1) availability in advance (Vorhandenheit) 2) advance appearance of a with-world (in dem mitweltlichen Vor-schein)

HDG.OHF.content: being-there in everydayness, an “in order to,” a “for,” such being there is a “stand[ing] in the way”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being-there in everydayness, an “in order to,” a “for,” such being there is a “stand[ing] in the way”

HDG.OHF.content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.content: phenomenology as discipline, coming to a fundamental “Sache,” which bears w/in itself (bei sich selbst trägt) possibility of research & how to do it
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: phenomenology as discipline, coming to a fundamental “Sache,” which bears w/in itself (bei sich selbst trägt) possibility of research & how to do it

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such

HDG.OHF.content: als bedeutet und bedeutend deuten: das Besorgen [pointing, signifying, care] > etwas bedeutet etwas: hebt es in bestimmten Verweisungszusammenhang, bestimmt sich aus dem Seienden, es ist da [thereness as signifying, as bringing into a definite context of references] — — self-evidence of the “ there ” : das Aufgehen absorption)

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
